definitions: wet swampy ground that is soft and muddy
difficult situation that is hard to escape from or make progress in
examples: The hikers got stuck in the mire after heavy rainfall
Their boots sank deep into the thick mire near the swamp
The company found itself in a legal mire of lawsuits
Political scandals trapped the administration in a mire of controversy

definitions: feeling of happiness and amusement shown through laughter and cheerfulness
examples: The children's mirth filled the playground with joyful sounds
Her witty jokes brought mirth to the entire dinner party

definitions: unlucky accident or unfortunate event that happens by chance
examples: Their camping trip turned into a misadventure when the storm arrived
The travel blog detailed their misadventure with lost luggage in Paris

definitions: state of being incorrectly positioned or not properly lined up
examples: The misalignment of the wheels caused the car to pull left
Spinal misalignment can lead to chronic back pain problems

definitions: dishonest or illegal use of money or property for purposes other than intended
examples: The accountant was charged with misappropriation of company funds
Misappropriation of donated money damaged the charity's reputation severely

definitions: improper or unacceptable behavior that violates rules or social norms
examples: The teacher addressed the student's misbehavior during class time
Repeated misbehavior led to his suspension from the team

definitions: improper or unacceptable behavior that violates rules or social norms
examples: The child's misbehaviour at the restaurant embarrassed his parents
School policies clearly outline consequences for student misbehaviour

definitions: mistake in calculating or error in judgment about a situation
examples: A small miscalculation in the budget caused major financial problems
His miscalculation of the distance led them to run out of fuel

definitions: spontaneous loss of pregnancy before the fetus can survive
failure of a legal system to deliver fair justice
examples: She needed emotional support after experiencing a miscarriage last month
Early miscarriage is more common than many people realize
The wrongful conviction was a clear miscarriage of justice
Lawyers worked to overturn what they called a miscarriage of justice

definitions: collection of various different items or writings grouped together
examples: The antique shop displayed a miscellany of vintage objects
Her book was a miscellany of poems and short stories

definitions: playful behavior that causes minor trouble or annoyance to others
examples: The puppy got into mischief while we were away from home
Children often make mischief when they're bored on rainy days

definitions: mistaken idea or incorrect understanding about something that many people believe
examples: It's a common misconception that all spiders are dangerous
The teacher corrected several misconceptions about historical events

definitions: unacceptable or improper behavior especially by someone in a professional position
examples: The officer was investigated for misconduct during the arrest
Professional misconduct can result in losing your medical license

definitions: criminal offense less serious than a felony usually punishable by fine or short jail term
examples: Shoplifting is typically charged as a misdemeanor for first offenders
Multiple misdemeanor convictions can affect your employment opportunities

definitions: person who hoards money and spends as little as possible
examples: The old miser counted his coins every night before bed
Despite his wealth, the miser refused to help his needy relatives

definitions: state of great physical or mental suffering and extreme unhappiness
examples: The refugees endured years of misery in the overcrowded camps
Her chronic pain caused constant misery that affected her daily life

definitions: failure of a gun or engine to fire properly
plan or joke that fails to have the intended effect
examples: The engine misfire caused the car to shake and lose power
The old rifle had a dangerous misfire at the shooting range
His attempt at humor was a complete misfire at the formal dinner
The marketing campaign was a misfire that cost millions

definitions: person whose behavior or attitude sets them apart from others in an uncomfortable way
examples: He felt like a misfit in the corporate environment
The school provided support for students who felt like misfits

definitions: bad luck or an unlucky event that causes problems or suffering
examples: They had the misfortune of arriving during the worst storm
A series of misfortunes left the family struggling financially

definitions: unlucky accident or minor unfortunate event that happens unexpectedly
examples: A kitchen mishap ruined their dinner plans for the evening
Despite several mishaps, they managed to complete the project on time

definitions: false or inaccurate information that is spread regardless of intent to mislead
examples: Social media platforms struggle to combat the spread of misinformation
The doctor corrected misinformation about vaccine safety

definitions: act of managing something badly or incompetently resulting in failure or waste
examples: Financial mismanagement led to the company's bankruptcy
Years of mismanagement left the department in complete chaos

definitions: combination of things or people that are not suitable for each other
examples: The color mismatch between the walls and furniture looked terrible
Their personality mismatch became obvious after a few dates

definitions: name or term that is inappropriate or misleading for what it describes
examples: Calling it a driveway is a misnomer since you park there
The term koala bear is a misnomer because koalas aren't bears

definitions: traditional Japanese seasoning paste made from fermented soybeans used in cooking
examples: She added miso to the soup for a rich umami flavor
White miso has a milder taste than the darker varieties

definitions: person who dislikes, despises, or is strongly prejudiced against women
examples: The misogynist made offensive comments about female coworkers
His misogynist attitudes became clear through his discriminatory behavior

definitions: dislike of, contempt for, or ingrained prejudice against women
examples: The report exposed widespread misogyny in the gaming industry
Fighting misogyny requires education and cultural change

definitions: act of reading or interpreting something incorrectly or misunderstanding its meaning
examples: His misreading of the map sent them miles off course
A misreading of her intentions led to an awkward situation

definitions: person sent by a church to spread religious faith in foreign countries
examples: The missionary spent years building schools in rural villages
Many missionaries also provide medical care and education services

definitions: word that has been spelled incorrectly or the act of spelling wrong
examples: The resume contained several embarrassing misspellings of common words
Autocorrect helps prevent misspellings in text messages

definitions: mistake in judgment or action that causes problems or embarrassment
examples: One political misstep could end her campaign for governor
His financial misstep cost the company thousands of dollars

definitions: informal term used to address a young girl sometimes in a patronizing way
examples: Listen here, missy, you need to finish your homework first
The old shopkeeper called every young girl missy

definitions: thin fog or cloud of tiny water droplets suspended in the air
examples: Morning mist covered the valley in a white blanket
She sprayed a fine mist of water on the delicate plants

definitions: act of wrongly identifying or misunderstanding someone or something
examples: There was no mistaking her anger when she slammed the door
Mistaking him for his twin brother caused an embarrassing moment

definitions: parasitic plant with white berries traditionally hung for Christmas kissing customs
examples: They hung mistletoe in the doorway for the holiday party
According to tradition, people kiss under the mistletoe

definitions: act of treating someone or something badly, cruelly, or unfairly
examples: The investigation revealed years of mistreatment at the nursing home
Animal mistreatment is punishable by law in most states

definitions: trial that is invalid due to error in proceedings or inability to reach verdict
examples: The judge declared a mistrial after discovering jury tampering
A hung jury resulted in a mistrial after five days

definitions: feeling of doubt or suspicion about someone's honesty or reliability
examples: Years of lies created deep mistrust between the partners
Public mistrust of politicians continues to grow each year

definitions: failure to understand something correctly or disagreement resulting from miscommunication
examples: A simple misunderstanding escalated into a major argument
Cultural misunderstandings can occur when traveling to foreign countries

definitions: wrong or inappropriate use of something often causing harm or waste
examples: Misuse of prescription drugs can lead to serious health problems
The audit revealed misuse of government funds

definitions: very small spider-like creature often found in dust or on plants
very small amount or insignificant contribution
examples: Dust mites can trigger allergies in sensitive people
The veterinarian treated the dog for ear mites
Every mite helps when we're collecting for charity
She didn't care a mite about his opinion

definitions: joint made by cutting two pieces at angles to form a corner
examples: The carpenter cut a perfect miter for the picture frame
Miter saws make precise angled cuts for trim work

definitions: action of reducing the severity, seriousness, or painfulness of something
examples: Flood mitigation efforts included building higher levees
The lawyer argued for mitigation of the sentence

definitions: tall pointed hat worn by bishops and senior clergy
joint made by cutting two pieces at angles to form a corner
examples: The bishop wore his ceremonial mitre during the Easter service
The golden mitre sparkled in the cathedral's candlelight
The woodworker created a perfect mitre joint for the cabinet
Mitre joints require precise cutting for a seamless fit

definitions: thick padded glove used in baseball or for handling hot items
examples: The catcher adjusted his mitt before the next pitch
She used oven mitts to remove the hot casserole

definitions: glove with single section for four fingers and separate section for thumb
examples: The child lost one mitten while playing in the snow
Wool mittens keep hands warmer than regular gloves

definitions: kitchen appliance or tool used to blend ingredients together
informal social event where people meet and mingle
examples: The electric mixer made quick work of the cake batter
She used a hand mixer to whip the cream
The company hosted a mixer for new employees
Singles mixers provide opportunities to meet new people

definitions: process of combining different substances or elements together
examples: Proper mixing ensures all ingredients are evenly distributed
The DJ's mixing skills kept the dance floor packed

definitions: device or technique that helps in remembering information or rules
examples: Students use the mnemonic PEMDAS to remember order of operations
Creating personal mnemonics can improve your memory retention significantly
